special_features: Commentary by Elisabeth Sladen, Philip Hinchcliffe and Bob Baker
Built for War - The genesis and development of the Sontaran race

releases.details: Released as a double video with Genesis of the Daleks

notes: The Sontaran Experiment follows the storytelling from the previous serial The Ark in Space.
It was unusually recorded entirely on location on videotape rather than film.
This was a rare two-part serial for the 1970s, unusual for its time.
Tom Baker sustained a collarbone injury while filming but continued shooting with a concealing neck brace.
Robert Holmes rewrote significant portions of episode two.

in_universe_mythology: Sontaran race and their endless war with the Rutans
Field Major Styre of the Sontaran G3 Military Assessment Survey
real_world_cultural_references: Harry mentions feeling like a Morse message.
The Doctor references Waterloo and Trafalgar Square.

continuity_notes: The Sontarans are emphasized as a clone race, linking to The Time Warrior.
It forms part of a continuous narrative arc beginning from Robot.

plot.plot_summary: The Fourth Doctor, along with companions Sarah Jane Smith and Harry Sullivan, arrives on a seemingly deserted Earth, where they encounter a group of shipwrecked astronauts from a distant Earth colony. The astronauts have been lured by a fake distress signal and are being experimented on by Field Major Styre, leading the Doctor to stop the Sontaran's plans for a full-scale invasion.
